description:
First though, The Look of Silence, a documentary that opened the Sheffield Documentary Festival, beautiful to look at, sometimes heightened in style and mood, but always only too real. Set in Indonesia and concerned with the 1960s slaughter of more than half a million people accused of communism, this film is a companion piece to The Act of Killing, the 2012 film that was Oscar nominated and won the BAFTA for best documentary. The first film presented lurid, often shocking vignettes of aging men who'd worked in or supervised the death squads, recounting, and even reconstructing their crimes as gangster films. Brilliant, provocative, it begged an obvious question: what about the victims and their families whose loss is barely recognised by the current government? Now director Joshua Oppenheimer has produced a second film, The Look of Silence, centred on a family whose son was murdered in 1965. In an unusual format, the younger brother Adi, an optometrist, visits the homes of the perpetrators. But Joshua Oppenheimer explained to me that The Look of Silence was not a sequel to The Act of Killing.

"They were very much conceived together. There's a scene in The Look of Silence of two death squad leaders bringing me to a spot where they'd helped kill 10,500 people. And this terrible day was the first time that I brought two perpetrators together from neighbouring death squads who didn't know each other. I'd been filming perpetrators for about eight months at this point, but always alone, because it was less dangerous. They're going to warn one another that they shouldn't speak, that the process was not likely to stop that way."

Colbie Caillat出生成长于加州马里布，父亲Ken Caillat正是民谣搖滚奇乐团Fleetwood Mac写下辉煌销售成绩经典大作 《Rumours》、《Tusk》的幕后制作推手﹔博客的影响力，使本想改行的蔻比仅用一年时间便在乐坛绽放才华。
受父亲（Ken Caillat）影响，从小接受古典钢琴训练，19岁时学习吉他，第一堂课结束就用吉他写下第一首歌曲。可是她的作品被音乐发行商看作是“陈词滥调”。喜爱音乐，却没有任何途径，于是她决定搬到夏威夷，改行作摄影师。
2006年9月，蔻比在博客上 发表单曲《Bubbly〔阳光微笑〕》和《The Little Things〔小事情〕》。吉他伴奏加上她轻盈悦耳的嗓音，很快得到网人的偏爱及推崇。她的音乐打动了无数的听众，歌曲的点击量也打动了音乐发行商。她不必被重新包装，发行商们“什么都没做，蔻比就把一切都做好了”。一位总裁在听了她的清唱之后，说：“You had me at hello(你一开口就征服了我)”。

话题：

Writing: imagine a scenario or express your opinion
Confident
Confident means having the ability to believe in oneself. What or who is confident? What causes the confidence? What will be the outcome?
This week's topic: They were confident... (90-110 words)

Suggestions:
1) feel confident about the presentation
2) a confident candidate
3) a confident performance
4) confident about the results
5) Instead of writing a scenario, feel free to comment on the story below.
